title: 2FA bypass - confirmation tokens don't expire

profile.name: TTS Bug Bounty
profile.about: The First Civilian Agency Public Bug Bounty Program

vulnerability_information:
Hi there,

Because of the limitation of the site, accounts may be locked down for 10 minutes. I found 2 ways to bypass this lock period.

First one with the confirmation mail that we get when we sign on. 

If we get the token this way below, we can change account password and bypass the lock period at once.

https://idp.staging.login.gov/sign_up/enter_password?confirmation_token=XXXXXX

*XXXXXX= Confirmation token of your account.

Second one is with a POST request below.

POST /manage/password HTTP/1.1
Host: staging.login.gov
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:54.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/54.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: tr-TR,tr;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.5,en;q=0.3
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 219
Referer: https://staging.login.gov/manage/password
Cookie: AWSALB=KkPbvp72NJDrfqzjC97hdllLC4+QMrw8qZXTGzNevDGz3y9nFRrtIyjghxsefOUKkaG2BJX5yhTOY71u+rgMVk5IDaL8G/90affS6zBZBbAOEqqGSp7fYSALOOEL; ahoy_visitor=345467de-0fb9-4154-af8f-329ba5d72408; ahoy_visit=62bcef39-2994-4866-92c8-d21895411c10; ahoy_track=true; _upaya_session=1b94772c05e0dbad70348c3db1f3ccf8; _ga=GA1.2.1438978135.1503936076; _gid=GA1.2.1732157595.1503936076; _ga=GA1.3.1438978135.1503936076; _gid=GA1.3.1732157595.1503936076
Connection: close
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1

utf8=%E2%9C%93&_method=patch&authenticity_token=bGs%2FBZHewYdpRsyPIe108KMc2sR1mK9SL1bbi0X%2F9IYZDJ%2Bh3SpUN79l84qk%2FXZS1%2Fx6Nd9VBVR%2BNCR2a95NZQ%3D%3D&update_user_password_form%5Bpassword%5D=test_?123%2B&commit=Update

If we get an used authenticity_token, we can still change the password and bypass the lock period at once.

King Regards.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi there,

Because of the limitation of the site, accounts may be locked down for 10 minutes. I found 2 ways to bypass this lock period.

First one with the confirmation mail that we get when we sign on.

If we get the token this way below, we can change account password and bypass the lock period at once.

https://idp.staging.login.gov/sign_up/enter_password?confirmation_token=XXXXXX

*XXXXXX= Confirmation token of your account.

Second one is with a POST request below.

POST /manage/password HTTP/1.1
Host: staging.login.gov
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:54.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/54.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,/;q=0.8
Accept-Language: tr-TR,tr;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.5,en;q=0.3
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 219
Referer: https://staging.login.gov/manage/password
Cookie: AWSALB=KkPbvp72NJDrfqzjC97hdllLC4+QMrw8qZXTGzNevDGz3y9nFRrtIyjghxsefOUKkaG2BJX5yhTOY71u+rgMVk5IDaL8G/90affS6zBZBbAOEqqGSp7fYSALOOEL; ahoy_visitor=345467de-0fb9-4154-af8f-329ba5d72408; ahoy_visit=62bcef39-2994-4866-92c8-d21895411c10; ahoy_track=true; _upaya_session=1b94772c05e0dbad70348c3db1f3ccf8; _ga=GA1.2.1438978135.1503936076; _gid=GA1.2.1732157595.1503936076; _ga=GA1.3.1438978135.1503936076; _gid=GA1.3.1732157595.1503936076
Connection: close
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1

utf8=%E2%9C%93&method=patch&authenticity_token=bGs%2FBZHewYdpRsyPIe108KMc2sR1mK9SL1bbi0X%2F9IYZDJ%2Bh3SpUN79l84qk%2FXZS1%2Fx6Nd9VBVR%2BNCR2a95NZQ%3D%3D&update_user_password_form%5Bpassword%5D=test?123%2B&commit=Update

If we get an used authenticity_token, we can still change the password and bypass the lock period at once.

King Regards.

Hi,

Thank you for your submission. We are investigating your report, and will let you know if we have any questions. We appreciate your assistance and cooperation. 

Regards.

Regards.

activities.message:
Hi,

I have a few questions: how does your account get locked down? Isn't the confirmation link get expired upon first use?

It would be very helpful if you can provide clear reproduction steps so we can speed up the verification process.

Regards.
activities.markdown_message:

I have a few questions: how does your account get locked down? Isn't the confirmation link get expired upon first use?

It would be very helpful if you can provide clear reproduction steps so we can speed up the verification process.

Regards.

Hi,

On 2FA screen. when you try to login with a lot of wrong pins, site says you account is locked for 10 minutes. I've shared screenshot below.

Hi,
No, it doesnt expire. I used it multiple times. Btw authenticity_token doesnt expire too.

Regards.

activities.message:
Hi,

The confirmation link is not an attack vector since it expires after 24 hours, however I am still unable to reproduce the password change using the provided HTTP request. After replaying it, I get redirected to the login page. Could you please provide clear steps on how you test for it?

Regards.
activities.markdown_message:

Regards.

activities.markdown_message:
Hi,

activities.message:
Hi,

Yes, I didnt show you in the video but when your account locked down, you can use this technique to reset your password and bypass your lock down either. Long story short, we can do multiple password changes with same token and this vulnerability triggers to bypass lock down, because when you change your account password website unloack your account automatically, so this is a bypass. I use another vulnerability(multiple password changes) as a trigger to bypass lock down issue. Are we clear now?

King regards.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,

Yes, I didnt show you in the video but when your account locked down, you can use this technique to reset your password and bypass your lock down either. Long story short, we can do multiple password changes with same token and this vulnerability triggers to bypass lock down, because when you change your account password website unloack your account automatically, so this is a bypass. I use another vulnerability(multiple password changes) as a trigger to bypass lock down issue. Are we clear now?

King regards.

activities.message:
Hi,

Token is not being expired because it is associated with user session. This is not a security vulnerability but if you can change your password while your account is on lock down that might be interesting. Can you do that?

Regards.

Regards.

activities.message:
Hi,

Your attack scenario is based on use of activation link retrieved from the compromised mailbox. Nevertheless, note that the link expires upon 24 hours which invalidates your scenario. Do you have any other way around?

Regards.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,

Your attack scenario is based on use of activation link retrieved from the compromised mailbox. Nevertheless, note that the link expires upon 24 hours which invalidates your scenario. Do you have any other way around?

Regards.

activities.message:
Hi,

That is one way that I've found. I've stored the link for 30 hours, it is working(I showed it also in my PoC video). But I can share it after 24 hours later with you, and you can set my account password too. Is that enough to consider this as a vulnerability sir?

Regards.

Regards.

activities.message: When you first signed up have you used that confirmation link? I think no because when I use it for the second time it says `Your email address has already been confirmed. Please sign in.` thus I am unable to use to bypass 2FA.
activities.markdown_message: When you first signed up have you used that confirmation link? I think no because when I use it for the second time it says Your email address has already been confirmed. Please sign in. thus I am unable to use to bypass 2FA.

activities.message:
Yes I used that confirmation link when I was creating my account. 

If you click the link in email, yes it says that. But in video I copied token of Url in the confirmation mail  and pasted it to my vulnerable link to bypass this message and create a new password. It bypasses 2FA, as you can see in video. I dont know how I can proof it anymore, I recorded a video. 

Lets try this;

Take your token in Url of your confirmation mail and paste it in HERE part of the link.

https://idp.staging.login.gov/sign_up/enter_password?confirmation_token=HERE&request_id=

I'll copy over your information from #264454 so that it's here in this thread, thanks for pointing it out to me!

activities.message:
Copying over more information on this issue by @muskecan from over in #264454:

----

Okey I am going to write whole scenario step by step. It will be long paragraph I'm sorry about that. By the way I will share my account details with you, so you can access my account without 2FA(I mean you will bypass it.)

In this scenario hacker has access to victim's e-mail account. Hacker resets password and sets a new password, but when hacker tries to login, two factor authentication system doesnt let hacker in because hacker doesnt have access victim's phone so he couldnt be able to enter 2FA key.

By the way you need to understand what 2FA is for. It is a second layer of security. The point of it is when hackers get the email account, it is not even enough because 2FA is enabled as a default settings in this website. Hacker needs to know what is the 2FA key but he cant know because he doesnt have access victim's phone. SO HACKER DOESNT LOGIN EVEN HE HAS ACCESS EMAILS, BECAUSE HE STILL NEEDS 2FA KEY.

For more info; http://searchsecurity.techtarget.com/definition/two-factor-authentication

But 2FA can be bypass with vulnerability that I've found. Firstly every account has confirmation mail to create account. IT IS A MUST. Hacker can reach the activation link because he has access to email account.

Here is my activation link; https://idp.staging.login.gov/sign_up/email/confirm?_request_id=&confirmation_token=1wzjBaAyfcVnS5iWgmxq

When you enter it looks like it doesnt work, but it does actually. The confirmation mail says "This link will expire in 24 hours." But it doesnt expire. I can use to create new password with SAME TOKEN (which doesnt expire in 24 hours). By the way I use the same token in the video, this token created aprox. 48 hours ago and I used it multiple times( You can see it in the video.)

This is where the whole point starts;

https://idp.staging.login.gov/sign_up/enter_password?confirmation_token=1wzjBaAyfcVnS5iWgmxq&request_id=

You can use this link to create new password and login directly without 2FA key needed. THIS IS THE VULNERABILITY. You can access my account directly with vulnerable link.

Just try to create a new password, you will login directly and you can see the screen that says PHONE CONFIRMED row.

After that please sign out and try to login with my account (email : mustafakemal.can@stu.bahcesehir.edu.tr) in normal ways with password that you created via vulnerable link, you'll see 2FA screen that says you need to enter 2FA key to access this account. But when you use vulnerable link, you doesnt have to enter 2FA key, because you've already bypassed it.

I'm sorry again because it is too long but I need to explain whole scenario. I hope you understand it better now.

----
activities.markdown_message:
Copying over more information on this issue by @muskecan from over in #264454:

Okey I am going to write whole scenario step by step. It will be long paragraph I'm sorry about that. By the way I will share my account details with you, so you can access my account without 2FA(I mean you will bypass it.)

In this scenario hacker has access to victim's e-mail account. Hacker resets password and sets a new password, but when hacker tries to login, two factor authentication system doesnt let hacker in because hacker doesnt have access victim's phone so he couldnt be able to enter 2FA key.

By the way you need to understand what 2FA is for. It is a second layer of security. The point of it is when hackers get the email account, it is not even enough because 2FA is enabled as a default settings in this website. Hacker needs to know what is the 2FA key but he cant know because he doesnt have access victim's phone. SO HACKER DOESNT LOGIN EVEN HE HAS ACCESS EMAILS, BECAUSE HE STILL NEEDS 2FA KEY.

For more info; http://searchsecurity.techtarget.com/definition/two-factor-authentication

But 2FA can be bypass with vulnerability that I've found. Firstly every account has confirmation mail to create account. IT IS A MUST. Hacker can reach the activation link because he has access to email account.

Here is my activation link; https://idp.staging.login.gov/sign_up/email/confirm?_request_id=&confirmation_token=1wzjBaAyfcVnS5iWgmxq

When you enter it looks like it doesnt work, but it does actually. The confirmation mail says "This link will expire in 24 hours." But it doesnt expire. I can use to create new password with SAME TOKEN (which doesnt expire in 24 hours). By the way I use the same token in the video, this token created aprox. 48 hours ago and I used it multiple times( You can see it in the video.)

This is where the whole point starts;

https://idp.staging.login.gov/sign_up/enter_password?confirmation_token=1wzjBaAyfcVnS5iWgmxq&request_id=

You can use this link to create new password and login directly without 2FA key needed. THIS IS THE VULNERABILITY. You can access my account directly with vulnerable link.

Just try to create a new password, you will login directly and you can see the screen that says PHONE CONFIRMED row.

After that please sign out and try to login with my account (email : mustafakemal.can@stu.bahcesehir.edu.tr) in normal ways with password that you created via vulnerable link, you'll see 2FA screen that says you need to enter 2FA key to access this account. But when you use vulnerable link, you doesnt have to enter 2FA key, because you've already bypassed it.

I'm sorry again because it is too long but I need to explain whole scenario. I hope you understand it better now.

summaries.content:
I found an interesting way to bypass 2FA on login.gov . Sometimes confirmation tokens can be very dangerous like in this case :) If you want to see more details about it, you can read my blogpost. 

http://mustafakemalcan.com/2017/11/14/bypass-two-factor-authentication-on-login-gov/

Thank you TTS security team and hackerone team! Take care :)
summaries.content_html:
I found an interesting way to bypass 2FA on login.gov . Sometimes confirmation tokens can be very dangerous like in this case :) If you want to see more details about it, you can read my blogpost.

http://mustafakemalcan.com/2017/11/14/bypass-two-factor-authentication-on-login-gov/

Thank you TTS security team and hackerone team! Take care :)
